description.narrative: Sida avser att bidra med femton miljoner kr till UNHCR för att finansiera projektet "Emergency Response for the Internally Displaced People in Eastern Ukraine". Huvudsyftet är att internflyktingar i Ukraina, som kommer från Donbass, ska få tillgång till nödvändiga tjänster och att deras grundläggande behov ska tillgodoses. Förmånstagarna är 6 100 familjer, eller 21 000 personer. UNHCR:s totala behov är ca 71,8 miljoner kr. Det svenska bidraget motsvarar därmed knappt 21% av behovet. Projektet kommer att fokusera på förberedelser för vintern, framförallt omedelbara bidrag med nödbostäder eller nödvändiga s.k. ”non-food item”, dvs nödvändiga varor med undantag för mat. Det rör sig om 4 000 set som inkluderar filtar, lakan, handdukar och varma kläder. Projektet innehåller också kontantstöd till 1 500 familjer om USD 400 i snitt, och 600 bostadsenheter av olika slag. Bostadsenheterna har ett varmt rum per förmånstagare/familj.

This intervention was based on a decision by the Swedish Government from August 21st 2014 stating that Sida was to allocate SEK 35 million to address the humanitarian crisis in Ukraine. The overall purpose with this intervention was to ensure that displaced persons receive essential services and that their basic needs are met. The initial activity period was 1st of August 2014 until 31st of December 2014, but a no-cost extension was approved prolonging the activity period until December 31st 2015. The total Swedish contribution amounted to SEK 15 million. The objective of the intervention was straightforward: immediate provision of emergency shelter assistance or provision of essential non-food items aiming to protect individuals during the winter season. Sweden provided funds without earmarking and UNHCR’s assessment was that with the Swedish funds 6,100 extremely vulnerable displaced families (21 000 individuals) would receive protection and assistance in Eastern Ukraine.

description.narrative: According to the general agreement between Sweden and UNHCR signed on June 28th 2013, UNHCR’s annual Global Report, including country chapters with achievements against priority targets were to be accepted by Sweden as UNCHR’s consolidated reporting mechanism. In the Global reports for 2014 and 2014 UNHCR reported the following results: - UNHCR worked with the Ukrainian government, local authorities and NGO’s to identify and respond to IDP’s immediate and long-term needs in the areas of protection monitoring, shelter and NFI distribution. UNHCR also advocated for the establishment of appropriate legislative framework, resulting in the adoption of an IDP law and registration procedures. The cluster approach was activated in December of 2014 in response to the protection and assistance needs of IDP’s. UNHCR also adopted the Strategy to Protect and Assist Persons Affected by the Conflict in Eastern Ukraine, outlining UNHCR’s strategic objectives and interventions in this regard (in 2014). - In 2015 UNHCR and OCHA were the only UN organizations authorized to conduct humanitarian activities in the NGCA’s in Luhansk. The organization continued to work with the Ukrainian government on several levels and CSO’s to identify and respond to the needs of IDP’s. UNHCR continued to lead the protection cluster and undertook a USD 6 million winterization programme across eastern Ukraine, which included cash assistance.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
